articles.title: Bill on ratification of "fisheries accord" with Japan railroaded through "National Assembly"
articles.content:
Bill on ratification of "fisheries accord" with Japan railroaded through "National Assembly" 
  Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- The South Korean coalition ruling parties, the "National Congress for New Politics" and the "United Liberal Democrats," on January 5 rushed some 70 "bills" through the "National Assembly," and on January 6 they also railroaded through the "National Assembly" the bill on the ratification of the treacherous "fisheries accord" with the Japanese reactionaries, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   At the "National assembly extraordinary session" they laid  the bill on the ratification of the "fisheries accord" and 65 other "bills" before the "National Assembly" in the "capacity of the chairman" and approved all of them in a little over ten minutes without the explanation of and deliberation on them, the radio said.
   Enraged by this, the opposition "assemblymen" began an indefinite sit-in, calling for a stop to the political surveillance and the withdrawal of the ratification of the "fisheries accord" at the main conference hall of the "National Assembly" building on the evening of January 6, the radio added.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of an in Hwan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of an in Hwan
Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a wreath  to the bier of labour Hero,  people's doctor, candidate academician, professor and doctor an in Hwan, a researcher of the Microbiological Institute of the Academy of medical science, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: Upwards of 2.3 million people interrogated in one�@year
articles.content:
Upwards of 2.3 million people interrogated in one�@year
  Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- More than 2.3 million people were interrogated by the prosecution in South Korea in 1998 alone, according to a radio report from Seoul.
   The figure shows that some 6,300 people were interrogated by the prosecution on a daily average.
   It proves that the self-styled "government for the people" intensified suppression of the people as never before.

articles.title: Indefinite overnight sit-in in S. Korea
articles.content:
Indefinite overnight sit-in in S. Korea
  Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- An estimated 200 trade union members of the Okchon Mint Branch Factory of the South Korean Mint Company went on an  indefinite overnight sit-in strike in protest against the unilateral "restructuring" of the management on January 6, a Seoul-based radio said.
   The protesters had a clash with the police of five companies who were called out to suppress them, calling for the right to existence. They had discussions on future struggle and vowed to fight it out.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial supported abroad
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial supported abroad
 Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- The Joint New Year Editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi has been fully supported in different countries.
   General Secretary of the central committee of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland) Alberto Moreno in a statement released on January 5 said that his party sincerely hopes that the Korean people will let this year mark a turning-point in building a powerful nation of socialism under the guidance of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
   He said that his party will as ever support with sincerity the Workers' Party of Korea and the Korean people in their struggle for the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.
   A lecture meeting, a symposium and a reading session on the Joint New Year Edition were held in Guyana and Ethiopia on January 4 and 5.
   A message of greetings to General Secretary Kim Jong Il was adopted at the reading session held in Ethiopia.

articles.title: Servicepersons meet
articles.content:
Servicepersons meet
 Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Soldiers of the three services of the Korean People's Army met to carry through militant tasks laid down in the Joint New Year Editorial.
   Meetings took place at units of the three services of the KPA.
   Servicepersons vowed to more firmly establish the revolutionary army commanding system and military discipline at the KPA units so that they can devotedly carry through the orders of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il with an absolute worship for him.
   At the meetings all the servicepersons hardened their determination to absolutely worship his great ideology, resolutely defend and carry through it and become invincible combatants in the struggle against class enemies.
   If the enemies dare encroach on an inch of land and a blade of grass of the DPRK, the KPA officers and men who carry forward the traditions of the guerilla army of Mt. Paektu will mercilessly annihilate the enemies and reunify the country, they said.

articles.title: Meeting held to pledge loyalty to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Meeting held to pledge loyalty to Kim Jong Il
  Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Members of the Saebyol Society in Masan, South Korea,  pledged loyalty to marshal Kim Jong Il with due ceremony on the New Year, Seoul-based radio Voice of National Salvation quoted the South Kyongsang Provincial Committee of the National Democratic Front of South Korea as saying.
   The participants wished good health and a long life to the marshal, the destiny of the nation and lodestar of national reunification, with a single heart of loyalty and filial piety.
   A resolution of loyalty to the marshal was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Socialist Korea will be powerful nation
articles.content:
Socialist Korea will be powerful nation
  Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary of the central committee of the All-India Forward Bloc D. Biswas had an interview with the KCNA in New Delhi January 3 on the New year.
   He said that the slogan "Let this year mark a turning- point in building a powerful nation " reflects the respected Kim Jong Il's iron will to defend and glorify socialist Korea.
   He expressed his belief that the heroic Korean people will build socialist Korea into a powerful nation in terms of politics, the economy and military affairs through a second grand march of Chollima under the guidance of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Japan's move to reinvade Korea denounced
articles.content:
Japan's move to reinvade Korea denounced
Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- The secretariat of the committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland issued information bulletin No. 777 on Saturday to denounce the Japanese military boss for exposing Japan's ambition to reinvade the Korean peninsula.
   The bulletin said:
   Director-general of the Defence Agency of Japan Hosei Norota's  tour of Panmunjom during his recent visit to South Korea clearly reveals Japan's ambition to reinvade the Korean peninsula, which is a grave provocation against the DPRK.
   It also shows that the Japanese reactionaries' design to stage a comeback to  Korea with the backing of the United States has entered  the stage of implementation.
   What is clear is that the war moves of the South Korean ruling quarters to invade the north according to the scenario of the U.S. imperialists have also gone beyond the limit line.
   The Japan as well as the U.S. is a sworn enemy of the Korean people. We will certainly square accounts with the Japanese Samurais any time.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on U.S. subcritical nuclear test
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on U.S. subcritical nuclear test
 Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- The subcritical nuclear test made by the United States on December 12 last year can not be justified in any case.
   Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun today says: 
   The United States seeks to continue the test, development and production of new nuclear weapons by such a method as subcritical nuclear test because it cannot openly make nuclear tests after the cold war.
   The U.S. plans to make a monopoly of nuclear weapons from the strategic point of view and enforce a policy of unrestricted domination through the subcritical nuclear test.
   The test may cause a "domino" phenomenon.
   Especially, a structure of nuclear confrontation  may be formed when the "partnership" of big powers splits or is broken.
   Then, the danger of thermonuclear war will grow more serious than in the Cold War era.
   It is only too natural that the international public denounces the test as a dangerous factor of a new nuclear arms race against the international demand for elimination of nuclear weapons.

articles.title: Japan is not qualified for UNSC permanent member
articles.content:
Japan is not qualified for UNSC permanent member 
 Pyongyang, January 10 (KCNA) -- Some time ago, the Russian ambassador to Japan criticized Japan for zealously supporting the military attack of the United States and Britain on Iraq in disregard of the United Nations Security Council (UNSC), saying that Japan's support does not agree with its purpose to become a permanent member of the UNSC.
   Assessing his criticism as impartial, a news analyst of Rodong Sinmun today says:
   The Japanese reactionaries were the first to support the U.S. attack on Iraq.
   What they sought in this is to egg the Uited Sates on to make an armed invasion of other nations as it attacked Iraq and thus take the opportunity to make an overseas aggression.
   Japan unhesitatingly ignored the sovereignty of the other country in disregard of the international law and the UN charter.
   Therefore, Japan has no elementary qualification to become a permanent member of the UNSC.
   Much effort is not needed to guess how shamelessly and impudently Japan will behave in case it gets the permanent membership. Then, the world will become confused and the sovereignty of other countries will be infringed upon.
   It is natural that the world is following Japan's movement with sharpened vigilance.
